content.title: Dr. S. Radhakrishnan UGC Post-Doctoral Fellowship
content.beneficiary: Unemployed candidates with a Ph.D. degree
content.details: The scheme 'Dr. S. Radhakrishnan UGC Post-Doctoral Fellowship' is a fellowship scheme by the University Grants Commission (UGC), Department of Higher Education (DoHE). Post-doctoral research is an important enabling step in grooming young researchers for launching an academic/research career. A post-doctoral stint also provides an opportunity to acquire new skills, broaden one's horizon and offer a platform for transition into cross-disciplinary areas. University Grants Commission provides opportunities for post-doctoral research under the UGC Post-doctoral fellowship schemes. The objective of these fellowships is to provide an opportunity to carry out advanced studies and research in Sciences, Engineering, and Technology, Humanities & Social Sciences including languages in Indian Universities/Institutions. The tenure of the fellowship is 3 years with no provision for further extension.
eligibility: Unemployed candidates with a Ph.D. degree in relevant subjects
Candidates below 35 years of age (age relaxation for SC/ST/OBC/Women/PWD/Transgender)
Candidates must resign from any other fellowship before accepting this fellowship
General category candidates must have a minimum of 55% marks at the Postgraduate level
exclusions: Persons already in regular service are not eligible to apply
Candidates who have already availed of any kind of Post-Doctoral Fellowship from UGC need not apply
content.application_process: Online applications are invited once a year through advertisements in leading newspapers & employment news. Applicants must register on the UGC website and follow the steps outlined in the application process.
documents_required: Scanned copy of passport-size photograph and signature
Complete Research proposal and an abstract
Auto-generated form signed by the HoD/Registrar

faqs.question: What Is Meant By 'Aadhaar Seeding'?
faqs.answer: The fellowship is directly paid to the research scholars in their bank accounts. For this, the bank account numbers of the scholars are required to be Aadhaar linked and verified.

faqs.question: Does Only The Submission Of An Application Form Guarantee The Award Of A Fellowship And Research Grant?
faqs.answer: No, mere submission of an application form does not guarantee the award of a Fellowship and Research Grant.

faqs.question: Can I Apply Offline For The Research Grant?
faqs.answer: No. You need to visit the official website to apply.

faqs.question: Is There Any Application Fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.
